title: URIError
description: The `URIError` JS object represents an error that occurs when there is a problem with encoding or decoding a URI, such as using `decodeURI()` incorrectly.
content: The object that represents an error when there is a problem with encoding or decoding a URI. This can occur with functions that handle URIs or URI components, such as `decodeURI()`, `encodeURI()`, `decodeURIComponent()` or `encodeURIComponent()`, when provided with invalid input. Itâ€™s used to manage issues related to improper URI handling.
